visualization_prompt: Generate a bar chart showing percentage composition of honey components using stacked percentages with rotated data labels
visualization_explanation: This visualization presents a unidimensional dataset comparing proportional composition of honey components. The categorical variable (biochemical constituents) is mapped to the x-axis, while quantitative percentages (mean composition ±2% measurement error) are represented through stacked bars. Synthetic data follows USDA nutritional guidelines with constrained sum (Σ=100%) and industry-standard value ranges for honey analysis. The stacked bar chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating axis lines while maintaining numerical precision through direct percentage labels. Angular text orientation follows Cairo's preattentive processing principles for rapid category recognition. Color saturation levels (L* = 70±5 in CIELAB) maintain perceptual uniformity across segments. Statistical validation confirms μ=20% average constituent presence with σ=14% standard deviation across components.
